title: How A New Deal Legacy Is Building Clean Energy In Rural North Carolina
description: In North Carolina, a rural electric cooperative is reliving its New Deal history, bringing technologies like fast Internet and clean, low-carbon heating to communities that some have abandoned.
copyright: Copyright 2019-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: How A New Deal Legacy Is Building Clean Energy In Rural North Carolina
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: The world stands on the cusp of a massive shift from fossil fuels to clean electricity, but many are worried that the transition won't be fair.
itunes:subtitle: The world stands on the cusp of a massive shift from fossil fuels to clean electricity, but many are worried that the transition won't be fair.
content:encoded: In North Carolina, a rural electric cooperative is reliving its New Deal history, bringing technologies like fast Internet and clean, low-carbon heating to communities that some have abandoned.
